maqras.text: What are they inquiring about
About the significant news
The one which they are in disagreement about
No, they will come to know
No, then again, they will come to know
Did We not make the earth a resting ground
And the mountains as pegs
And We created you in pairs
And We made your sleep for resting
And We made the night as a covering
And We made the day to work in
And We constructed above you seven mighty ones
And We made a blazing lamp
And We sent down from the clouds abundant water
To bring out with it seeds and plants
And gardens of thick growth
The Day of Separation is an appointed time
The Day when the horn is blown and you come in crowds
And the heaven is opened, so it becomes gates
And the mountains will be moved as if they were a mirage
For Hell is in wait
For the transgressors it is a dwelling
They will be in it for eons
They will not taste any coolness in it nor drink
Except that which is boiling and dark
An exact recompense
They did not expect the reckoning
And they denied Our revelations greatly
And everything We have counted in a record
So taste it, for no increase will come to you from Us except in retribution
As for the righteous, they will have triumph
Gardens and vineyards
And bunches that are ripe
And a cup that is full
They do not hear in it any vain talk or lies
A reward from your Lord, in recognition for what is done
The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, the Almighty. They do not possess any authority besides Him
The Day when the Spirit and the angels stand in line, none will speak unless the Almighty permits him and he speaks what is true
That is the Day of truth, so let whoever wills seek refuge to his Lord
I have warned you of a retribution which is close, the Day when man will look at what he has brought forth and the rejecter will say: "I wish I were dust
By those that take the person forcibly
And those that take the person gently
And those that swim along
And those that press forward in a race
So as to carry out a command
On the Day the ground shakes
It will be followed by the second blow
Hearts on that Day will be terrified
Their eyes cast down
They say: "Shall we be returned to live our lives
Even after we were crumbled bones
They said: "This is an impossible recurrence
But all it takes is one blow
Whereupon they will rise-up
Did the narrative of Moses come to you
His Lord called him at the holy valley of Tuwa
Go to Pharaoh, for he has transgressed
Tell him: "Would you not be purified
And I will guide you to your Lord, that you may be concerned
He then showed him the great sign
But he disbelieved and rebelled
Then he turned away in a hurry
So he gathered and proclaimed
He said: "I am your lord, the most high
So God seized him for punishment in the Hereafter, and for the first life
In that is a lesson for those who are concerned
Are you a more powerful creation than the heaven which He built
He raised its height, and perfected it
And He covered its night and brought out its morning
And the land after that He spread out
He brought forth from it its water and pasture
And the mountains He fixed firmly
All this to be a provision for you and your livestock
Then, when the great blow comes
The Day when man remembers all that he strove for
And Hell will be made apparent for all who can see
As for he who transgressed
And was preoccupied with the worldly life
Then Hell will be the abode
And as for he who feared the station of his Lord, and prohibited the self from desire
The Paradise will be the abode
They ask you about the Hour: "When is its appointed time
You have no knowledge of it
To your Lord is its term
You are simply to warn those who are concerned by it
For the Day they see it, it will be as if they had remained an evening or half a day
